question: How long is the term of office for the President in the Federation of Pakistan?
Which country's constitution is being discussed in the text?
How many members can the Cabinet of the Provincial Assembly have according to the Constitution?
According to the constitution who will be guilty of high treason?
How the constitution is securing child labour?
answer: I couldn't find a good response to your query in the database.
The country's constitution being discussed in the text is the Constitution of the Islamic Republic of Pakistan.

According to the Constitution, the total strength of the Cabinet shall not exceed fifteen members or eleven percent of the total membership of a Provincial Assembly, whichever is higher.assistant: According to the Constitution, the total strength of the Cabinet shall not exceed fifteen members or eleven percent of the total membership of a Provincial Assembly, whichever is higher.

According to the constitution, any person who holds in abeyance, attempts or conspires to abrogate or subvert or suspend or hold in abeyance the Constitution by use of force or show of force or by any other unconstitutional means shall be guilty of high treason.

The Constitution of Pakistan has made provisions to secure child labour by prohibiting the engagement of children below the age of 14 years in any factory, mine, or hazardous employment. Article 11 (3) of the Constitution specifically states that "No child below the age of fourteen years shall be engaged in any factory or mine or any other hazardous employment." This provision aims to protect the rights and well-being of children and ensure that they are not subjected to exploitative or harmful working conditions. Additionally, the Constitution also emphasizes the importance of ensuring just and humane conditions of work, including the provision of maternity benefits for women in employment, to promote the welfare and dignity of workers, including children.

Provided that the President shall, notwithstanding the 
expiration of his terms, continue to hold office until his successor enters upon his office.
(2)Subject to the Constitution, a person holding 
office as President shall be eligible for re-election to that
office, but no person shall hold that office for more than 
two consecutive terms.
(3)The President may, by writing under his hand

Islamic Republic of Pakistan
The total strength of the Cabinet,including Ministers of State, shall not exceed eleven percent of the total membership of Majlis-e-Shoora (Parliament).

Any person who abrogates or subverts or suspends or holds in abeyance, or attempts or conspires to abrogate or subvert or suspend or hold in abeyance, the Constitution by use of force or show of force or by any other unconstitutional meanshall be guilty of high treason.
No child below the age of fourteen years shall be engaged in any factory or mine or any other hazardous employment.
